text: Cask at the lovely brewery, 6/11/16, listed at 3.7% abv.Dark mahogany-to-ebony body has light cola tints and shows a seemingly high clarity. Tan head is large and shows moderately strong retention.Big fruits in the nose mix with prune, dark chocolate, vanilla and a chalky-like minerality. Light treacle balances the creamy-honey base malts with more esters lingering on the end.Fruity again, in the mouth, with apple, strawberry, cherry-like esters as well as prunes and treacle to deepen things and add a bit of acidity. Roasted barley is not overdone, but adds a touch of char and lots of dark chocolate, as well. Soft, amply carbonated texture is slick at times and appropriately watery for quite a high drinkability. Love the abv, love the cleanliness and love the condition of the cask.
Pours jet black with a thick mocha head. Aroma of roast and chocolate. Taste follows, light yet flavorful.

At the source: pours dark brown with a loose cask head. Aroma is roast, chocolate, and maybe a coffee. Taste is not very bitter or sweet. But it was a very nice dry stout. Mild and easy to drink. Good.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a very dark brown with small beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is roast, toffee, chocolate, wood. Thin mouthfeel, dark chocolate, roasted malt, lingering dryness, very good.

On tap at F and M. Pours black with medium mocha colored head. Very boring and chalky but a lot of English styles are like this. Wish it was hoppier but thats personal preference and didnt factor into the rate. Notes of peanut, coffee, dirty soil, cinnamon smooth malt. Its very clean and easy going but bland/light for todays hop crazed youth
Cask at the brewpub. Pours black with a medium sized brown head that dissipates slowly. The aroma has a smoky nose, a bit if dark chocolate. The taste has smoke, fire, really nice take on the style.

On tap at the brewery on Fathers Day. Pours black in color with a small foamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, weak coffee, smoke, cinnamon, and booze. Taste of roasted malt, old coffee, cardboard, and hints of vanilla. On the flat side, like half the beers Ive tried here today!

On tap at the brewpub, served in a tasting glass. Pours clear ruby-chestnut with a small tan head that fades to a thin remnant and leaves a moderate amount of fine lace. The nose has big coffee and roast malts with a touch of smoke. The flavour is dry with roasty notes, coffee and perhaps a touch of chocolate. The finish is short and soft with a nice roastiness. On the palate it is medium in body with a smooth, watery texture and soft carbonation. Overall this is a decent roasty ale with very smooth malts but a bit too light in body for the style. 2014-05-02

Tasted on hand pump at Forest & Main. Pours dark brown with a toffee head. Nose is roasted malts, coffee beans, and chocolate. Flavour is more hoppy than the nose suggests. Very light bodied for a Stout.
Hand pump. Black pour with tan head. Chocolate and roasted aromas. Chocolate, vanilla and roasted flavors. One of the better cask stouts Ive had.

Tap flight at the brewpub. Dark black pour with a well laced egg shell head. Aroma is charred wood and dark cacao. Tasty is roasty with a touch of fennel seed and anise. Much more flavorful than expected. Dry in the mouth. A great dry stout.

near black, coffee head diminishes to oily island and ring. Nose is harsh, very strong coffee, earth, dark roasts. Flavor is light mint front, chocolate stronger mid before roast, woody and dry earth finish, light anise. Integrated and controlled.

Cask at forest and main. Clear dark ruby. Medium coffee foam. Decent lace. Nose is licorice, anise, fennel, salted dark chocolate, rich creme brulee. Taste is bitter dark chocolate, cookie. Dense, lactic palate. Amazing for abv.
On tap at Forest & Main last weekend.  Nose is nice with a bit of roasted malt and chocolate.  Flavor has roast and chocolate plus a mild bitterness.  Light and dry.  Quite drinkable.
Nearly opaque black with a medium sized, tan head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of roasted malts, burnt toffee, and light vanilla bean. Taste of much of the same, quite roasty.

Pours black with no head.  Aroma is peaty with very mild dark fruits...roasty...smoke.  flavor has lots of smokiness and peat...a bit of a band aid note...faint bitter chocolate.  Mouthfeel is light and the finish is peaty/smoky/band aidy and dry.

Draft at forest and main with Dallas. Pours a deep. Lack body with no head or lacing. Aroma is sweet chocolate and roast. Mouthfeel is medium to thin with notes of bitter chocolate, coffee roast and toasted caramel malts. Good.

Draft at F&M. Pours a pitch black with just a little head. Nice chocolatey-coffee aroma. Taste has a lot of coffee, not a lot of hops, and some residual dark chocolate. Finishes very smooth, almost creamy. Really flavorful for 3.5%
Dark brown-black body, substantial khaki head, quality lacing.  Roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, light caramel.  Nice dry stout profile.  Medium bodied, creamy carbonation, dry finish.

Draft at F&M.  Pours dark brownish black with tan head.  Nose was rich roasty black patent and choc malt, cacao, nuts.  Tasted dry, with a big rich roasty malt flavor up front, cacao, blackberry, backup hops, and coffee.  The palate was dense and very complex, and this one was stellar.
Pours a dark cola brown with a tan head.  Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate.  Mostly roasted malt flavor with hint of chocolate to round out the beer.  Very smooth and easy to drink.

Dark with a creamy off-white head.  Aroma is light on the roasted malt, a bit of chocolate, too.  Flavor is light, but thats to be expected for the abv. Roasty, light cocoa, a bit of earth tones. Not  powerhouse of flavor but easy drinking and good for a spring afternoon.
